result.execSummary:
The defendant Lois D Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Defendant is not to use or possess anyone elses financial or identifying information except her own.
Not to have any employment that would put her in possession of anyone elses financial/identifying information.
Not to have any employment in a care giving capacity.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residence.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

timeConds.notes:
First 20 days to be served Non-working hours (Huber) with standard release conditions and balance to be STAYED (to be used at Agent's discretion).
Defendant to report to the Huber facility by 06:00 p.m. on 03-20-2015.
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.

Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lois D Harper in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  18 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Not to use or possess anyone elses financial or identifying information except her own.
Not to have any employment that would put her in possession of anyone elses financial/identifying information.
Not to have any employment in a care giving capacity.
No Use or Possession controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling .
No contact with:  Victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or their family or residence.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
40 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.
First 20 Days to served and balance to be STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion. 
Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 6:00 p.m. on: 03/20/15.
 
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on March 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
